00050 #define IS_jpg(x)       (x->ftype & JPG)
00051 #define IS_stdjpg(x)    ((x->ftype & JPG_MSK) == JPG_STD)
00052 #define IS_vidjpg(x)    ((x->ftype & JPG_MSK) == JPG_VID)
00053 #define IS_jstjpg(x)    ((x->ftype & JPG_MSK) == JPG_JST)
00054 #define IS_maxjpg(x)    ((x->ftype & JPG_MSK) == JPG_MAX)

00066 
00067 /*
00068  * In principle there are 4 jpeg formats.
00069  *
00070  * 1. jpeg - standard printing, u & v at quarter of resulution
00071  * 2. jvid - standaard video, u & v half resolution, frame not interlaced
00072  *
00073  * type 3 is unsupported as of jul 05 2000 Frank.
00074  *
00075  * 3. jstr - as 2, but written in 2 separate fields
00076  *
00077  * 4. jmax - no scaling in the components
00078  */
00079 
00080 static int jpeg_default_quality;
00081 static int ibuf_ftype;
00082 
00083 int imb_is_a_jpeg(unsigned char *mem)
00084 {
00085     if ((mem[0]== 0xFF) && (mem[1] == 0xD8))return 1;
00086     return 0;
00087 }

00090 //  JPG ERROR HANDLING

00092 
00093 typedef struct my_error_mgr {
00094     struct jpeg_error_mgr pub;  /* "public" fields */
00095 
00096     jmp_buf setjmp_buffer;  /* for return to caller */
00097 } my_error_mgr;
00098 
00099 typedef my_error_mgr * my_error_ptr;
00100 
00101 static void jpeg_error (j_common_ptr cinfo)
00102 {
00103     my_error_ptr err = (my_error_ptr)cinfo->err;
00104 
00105     /* Always display the message */
00106     (*cinfo->err->output_message) (cinfo);
00107 
00108     /* Let the memory manager delete any temp files before we die */
00109     jpeg_destroy(cinfo);
00110 
00111     /* return control to the setjmp point */
00112     longjmp(err->setjmp_buffer, 1);
00113 }

00115 //----------------------------------------------------------
00116 //  INPUT HANDLER FROM MEMORY
00117 //----------------------------------------------------------
00118 
00119 typedef struct {
00120     unsigned char   *buffer;
00121     int     filled;
00122 } buffer_struct;
00123 
00124 typedef struct {
00125     struct jpeg_source_mgr pub; /* public fields */
00126 
00127     unsigned char   *buffer;
00128     int             size;
00129     JOCTET          terminal[2];
00130 } my_source_mgr;
00131 
00132 typedef my_source_mgr * my_src_ptr;
00133 
00134 static void init_source(j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
00135 {
00136     (void)cinfo; /* unused */
00137 }
00138 
00139 
00140 static boolean fill_input_buffer(j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
00141 {
00142     my_src_ptr src = (my_src_ptr) cinfo->src;
00143 
00144     /* Since we have given all we have got already
00145      * we simply fake an end of file
00146      */
00147 
00148     src->pub.next_input_byte = src->terminal;
00149     src->pub.bytes_in_buffer = 2;
00150     src->terminal[0] = (JOCTET) 0xFF;
00151     src->terminal[1] = (JOCTET) JPEG_EOI;
00152 
00153     return TRUE;
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 static void skip_input_data(j_decompress_ptr cinfo, long num_bytes)
00158 {
00159     my_src_ptr src = (my_src_ptr) cinfo->src;
00160 
00161     if (num_bytes > 0) {
00162         // prevent skipping over file end
00163         size_t skip_size = (size_t)num_bytes <= src->pub.bytes_in_buffer ? num_bytes : src->pub.bytes_in_buffer;
00164 
00165         src->pub.next_input_byte = src->pub.next_input_byte + skip_size;
00166         src->pub.bytes_in_buffer = src->pub.bytes_in_buffer - skip_size;
00167     }
00168 }
00169 
00170 
00171 static void term_source(j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
00172 {
00173     (void)cinfo; /* unused */
00174 }
00175 
00176 static void memory_source(j_decompress_ptr cinfo, unsigned char *buffer, size_t size)
00177 {
00178     my_src_ptr src;
00179 
00180     if (cinfo->src == NULL) { /* first time for this JPEG object? */
00181         cinfo->src = (struct jpeg_source_mgr *)(*cinfo->mem->alloc_small)
00182             ((j_common_ptr) cinfo, JPOOL_PERMANENT, sizeof(my_source_mgr));
00183     }
00184 
00185     src = (my_src_ptr) cinfo->src;
00186     src->pub.init_source        = init_source;
00187     src->pub.fill_input_buffer  = fill_input_buffer;
00188     src->pub.skip_input_data    = skip_input_data;
00189     src->pub.resync_to_restart  = jpeg_resync_to_restart;
00190     src->pub.term_source        = term_source;
00191 
00192     src->pub.bytes_in_buffer    = size;
00193     src->pub.next_input_byte    = buffer;
00194 
00195     src->buffer = buffer;
00196     src->size = size;
00197 }
00198 
00199 
00200 #define MAKESTMT(stuff)     do { stuff } while (0)
00201 
00202 #define INPUT_VARS(cinfo)  \
00203     struct jpeg_source_mgr * datasrc = (cinfo)->src;  \
00204     const JOCTET * next_input_byte = datasrc->next_input_byte;  \
00205     size_t bytes_in_buffer = datasrc->bytes_in_buffer
00206 
00207 /* Unload the local copies --- do this only at a restart boundary */
00208 #define INPUT_SYNC(cinfo)  \
00209     ( datasrc->next_input_byte = next_input_byte,  \
00210       datasrc->bytes_in_buffer = bytes_in_buffer )
00211 
00212 /* Reload the local copies --- seldom used except in MAKE_BYTE_AVAIL */
00213 #define INPUT_RELOAD(cinfo)  \
00214     ( next_input_byte = datasrc->next_input_byte,  \
00215       bytes_in_buffer = datasrc->bytes_in_buffer )
00216 
00217 /* Internal macro for INPUT_BYTE and INPUT_2BYTES: make a byte available.
00218  * Note we do *not* do INPUT_SYNC before calling fill_input_buffer,
00219  * but we must reload the local copies after a successful fill.
00220  */
00221 #define MAKE_BYTE_AVAIL(cinfo, action)                                        \
00222     if (bytes_in_buffer == 0) {                                               \
00223         if (! (*datasrc->fill_input_buffer) (cinfo))                          \
00224             { action; }                                                       \
00225         INPUT_RELOAD(cinfo);  \
00226     }
00227 
00228 
00229 /* Read a byte into variable V.
00230  * If must suspend, take the specified action (typically "return FALSE").
00231  */
00232 #define INPUT_BYTE(cinfo,V,action)  \
00233     MAKESTMT( MAKE_BYTE_AVAIL(cinfo,action); \
00234           bytes_in_buffer--; \
00235           V = GETJOCTET(*next_input_byte++); )
00236 
00237 /* As above, but read two bytes interpreted as an unsigned 16-bit integer.
00238  * V should be declared unsigned int or perhaps INT32.
00239  */
00240 #define INPUT_2BYTES(cinfo,V,action)  \
00241     MAKESTMT( MAKE_BYTE_AVAIL(cinfo,action); \
00242           bytes_in_buffer--; \
00243           V = ((unsigned int) GETJOCTET(*next_input_byte++)) << 8; \
00244           MAKE_BYTE_AVAIL(cinfo,action); \
00245           bytes_in_buffer--; \
00246           V += GETJOCTET(*next_input_byte++); )
00247 
00248 
00249 static boolean
00250 handle_app1 (j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
00251 {
00252     INT32 length; /* initialized by the macro */
00253     INT32 i;
00254     char neogeo[128];
00255     
00256     INPUT_VARS(cinfo);
00257 
00258     INPUT_2BYTES(cinfo, length, return FALSE);
00259     length -= 2;
00260     
00261     if (length < 16) {
00262         for (i = 0; i < length; i++) INPUT_BYTE(cinfo, neogeo[i], return FALSE);
00263         length = 0;
00264         if (strncmp(neogeo, "NeoGeo", 6) == 0) memcpy(&ibuf_ftype, neogeo + 6, 4);
00265         ibuf_ftype = BIG_LONG(ibuf_ftype);
00266     }
00267     INPUT_SYNC(cinfo);      /* do before skip_input_data */
00268     if (length > 0) (*cinfo->src->skip_input_data) (cinfo, length);
00269     return TRUE;
00270 }

00272 
00273 static ImBuf * ibJpegImageFromCinfo(struct jpeg_decompress_struct * cinfo, int flags)
00274 {
00275     JSAMPARRAY row_pointer;
00276     JSAMPLE * buffer = NULL;
00277     int row_stride;
00278     int x, y, depth, r, g, b, k;
00279     struct ImBuf * ibuf = NULL;
00280     uchar * rect;
00281     jpeg_saved_marker_ptr marker;
00282     char *str, *key, *value;
00283 
00284     /* install own app1 handler */
00285     ibuf_ftype = 0;
00286     jpeg_set_marker_processor(cinfo, 0xe1, handle_app1);
00287     cinfo->dct_method = JDCT_FLOAT;
00288     jpeg_save_markers(cinfo, JPEG_COM, 0xffff);
00289 
00290     if (jpeg_read_header(cinfo, FALSE) == JPEG_HEADER_OK) {
00291         x = cinfo->image_width;
00292         y = cinfo->image_height;
00293         depth = cinfo->num_components;
00294 
00295         if (cinfo->jpeg_color_space == JCS_YCCK) cinfo->out_color_space = JCS_CMYK;
00296 
00297         jpeg_start_decompress(cinfo);
00298 
00299         if (ibuf_ftype == 0) {
00300             ibuf_ftype = JPG_STD;
00301             if (cinfo->max_v_samp_factor == 1) {
00302                 if (cinfo->max_h_samp_factor == 1) ibuf_ftype = JPG_MAX;
00303                 else ibuf_ftype = JPG_VID;
00304             }
00305         }
00306 
00307         if (flags & IB_test) {
00308             jpeg_abort_decompress(cinfo);
00309             ibuf = IMB_allocImBuf(x, y, 8 * depth, 0);
00310         }
00311         else if ((ibuf = IMB_allocImBuf(x, y, 8 * depth, IB_rect)) == NULL) {
00312             jpeg_abort_decompress(cinfo);
00313         }
00314         else {
00315             row_stride = cinfo->output_width * depth;
00316 
00317             row_pointer = (*cinfo->mem->alloc_sarray) ((j_common_ptr) cinfo, JPOOL_IMAGE, row_stride, 1);
00318             
00319             for (y = ibuf->y - 1; y >= 0; y--) {
00320                 jpeg_read_scanlines(cinfo, row_pointer, 1);
00321                 rect = (uchar *) (ibuf->rect + y * ibuf->x);
00322                 buffer = row_pointer[0];
00323                 
00324                 switch(depth) {
00325                     case 1:
00326                         for (x=ibuf->x; x >0; x--) {
00327                             rect[3] = 255;
00328                             rect[0] = rect[1] = rect[2] = *buffer++;
00329                             rect += 4;
00330                         }
00331                         break;
00332                     case 3:
00333                         for (x=ibuf->x; x >0; x--) {
00334                             rect[3] = 255;
00335                             rect[0] = *buffer++;
00336                             rect[1] = *buffer++;
00337                             rect[2] = *buffer++;
00338                             rect += 4;
00339                         }
00340                         break;
00341                     case 4:
00342                         for (x=ibuf->x; x >0; x--) {
00343                             r = *buffer++;
00344                             g = *buffer++;
00345                             b = *buffer++;
00346                             k = *buffer++;
00347                             
00348                             k = 255 - k;
00349                             r -= k;
00350                             if (r & 0xffffff00) {
00351                                 if (r < 0) r = 0;
00352                                 else r = 255;
00353                             }
00354                             g -= k;
00355                             if (g & 0xffffff00) {
00356                                 if (g < 0) g = 0;
00357                                 else g = 255;
00358                             }
00359                             b -= k;
00360                             if (b & 0xffffff00) {
00361                                 if (b < 0) b = 0;
00362                                 else b = 255;
00363                             }
00364                             
00365                             rect[3] = 255 - k;
00366                             rect[2] = b;
00367                             rect[1] = g;
00368                             rect[0] = r;
00369                             rect += 4;
00370                         }
00371                 }
00372             }
00373 
00374             marker= cinfo->marker_list;
00375             while (marker) {
00376                 if (marker->marker != JPEG_COM)
00377                     goto next_stamp_marker;
00378 
00379                 /*
00380                  * Because JPEG format don't support the
00381                  * pair "key/value" like PNG, we store the
00382                  * stampinfo in a single "encode" string:
00383                  *  "Blender:key:value"
00384                  *
00385                  * That is why we need split it to the
00386                  * common key/value here.
00387                  */
00388                 if (strncmp((char *) marker->data, "Blender", 7)) {
00389                     /*
00390                      * Maybe the file have text that
00391                      * we don't know "what it's", in that
00392                      * case we keep the text (with a
00393                      * key "None").
00394                      * This is only for don't "lose"
00395                      * the information when we write
00396                      * it back to disk.
00397                      */
00398                     IMB_metadata_add_field(ibuf, "None", (char *) marker->data);
00399                     ibuf->flags |= IB_metadata;
00400                     goto next_stamp_marker;
00401                 }
00402 
00403                 str = BLI_strdup ((char *) marker->data);
00404                 key = strchr (str, ':');
00405                 /*
00406                  * A little paranoid, but the file maybe
00407                  * is broken... and a "extra" check is better
00408                  * then segfault ;)
00409                  */
00410                 if (!key) {
00411                     MEM_freeN(str);
00412                     goto next_stamp_marker;
00413                 }
00414 
00415                 key++;
00416                 value = strchr (key, ':');
00417                 if (!value) {
00418                     MEM_freeN(str);
00419                     goto next_stamp_marker;
00420                 }
00421 
00422                 *value = '\0'; /* need finish the key string */
00423                 value++;
00424                 IMB_metadata_add_field(ibuf, key, value);
00425                 ibuf->flags |= IB_metadata;
00426                 MEM_freeN(str);
00427 next_stamp_marker:
00428                 marker= marker->next;
00429             }
00430 
00431             jpeg_finish_decompress(cinfo);
00432         }
00433         
00434         jpeg_destroy((j_common_ptr) cinfo);
00435         if (ibuf) {
00436             ibuf->ftype = ibuf_ftype;
00437             ibuf->profile = IB_PROFILE_SRGB;
00438         }
00439     }
00440 
00441     return(ibuf);
00442 }
00443 
00444 ImBuf * imb_load_jpeg (unsigned char * buffer, size_t size, int flags)
00445 {
00446     struct jpeg_decompress_struct _cinfo, *cinfo = &_cinfo;
00447     struct my_error_mgr jerr;
00448     ImBuf * ibuf;
00449 
00450     if (!imb_is_a_jpeg(buffer)) return NULL;
00451     
00452     cinfo->err = jpeg_std_error(&jerr.pub);
00453     jerr.pub.error_exit = jpeg_error;
00454 
00455     /* Establish the setjmp return context for my_error_exit to use. */
00456     if (setjmp(jerr.setjmp_buffer)) {
00457         /* If we get here, the JPEG code has signaled an error.
00458          * We need to clean up the JPEG object, close the input file, and return.
00459          */
00460         jpeg_destroy_decompress(cinfo);
00461         return NULL;
00462     }
00463 
00464     jpeg_create_decompress(cinfo);
00465     memory_source(cinfo, buffer, size);
00466 
00467     ibuf = ibJpegImageFromCinfo(cinfo, flags);
00468     
00469     return(ibuf);
00470 }
00471 
00472 
00473 static void write_jpeg(struct jpeg_compress_struct * cinfo, struct ImBuf * ibuf)
00474 {
00475     JSAMPLE * buffer = NULL;
00476     JSAMPROW row_pointer[1];
00477     uchar * rect;
00478     int x, y;
00479     char neogeo[128];
00480     ImMetaData *iptr;
00481     char *text;
00482 
00483     jpeg_start_compress(cinfo, TRUE);
00484 
00485     strcpy(neogeo, "NeoGeo");
00486     ibuf_ftype = BIG_LONG(ibuf->ftype);
00487     
00488     memcpy(neogeo + 6, &ibuf_ftype, 4);
00489     jpeg_write_marker(cinfo, 0xe1, (JOCTET*) neogeo, 10);
00490 
00491     if (ibuf->metadata) {
00492         /* key + max value + "Blender" */
00493         text= MEM_mallocN(530, "stamp info read");
00494         iptr= ibuf->metadata;
00495         while (iptr) {
00496             if (!strcmp (iptr->key, "None")) {
00497                 jpeg_write_marker(cinfo, JPEG_COM, (JOCTET *) iptr->value, strlen (iptr->value) + 1);
00498                 goto next_stamp_info;
00499             }
00500 
00501             /*
00502              * The JPEG format don't support a pair "key/value"
00503              * like PNG, so we "encode" the stamp in a
00504              * single string:
00505              *  "Blender:key:value"
00506              *
00507              * The first "Blender" is a simple identify to help
00508              * in the read process.
00509              */
00510             sprintf (text, "Blender:%s:%s", iptr->key, iptr->value);
00511             jpeg_write_marker(cinfo, JPEG_COM, (JOCTET *) text, strlen (text)+1);
00512 next_stamp_info:
00513             iptr = iptr->next;
00514         }
00515         MEM_freeN(text);
00516     }
00517 
00518     row_pointer[0] =
00519         MEM_mallocN(sizeof(JSAMPLE) *
00520                      cinfo->input_components *
00521                      cinfo->image_width, "jpeg row_pointer");
00522 
00523     for (y = ibuf->y - 1; y >= 0; y--) {
00524         rect = (uchar *) (ibuf->rect + y * ibuf->x);
00525         buffer = row_pointer[0];
00526 
00527         switch(cinfo->in_color_space) {
00528             case JCS_RGB:
00529                 for (x = 0; x < ibuf->x; x++) {
00530                     *buffer++ = rect[0];
00531                     *buffer++ = rect[1];
00532                     *buffer++ = rect[2];
00533                     rect += 4;
00534                 }
00535                 break;
00536             case JCS_GRAYSCALE:
00537                 for (x = 0; x < ibuf->x; x++) {
00538                     *buffer++ = rect[0];
00539                     rect += 4;
00540                 }
00541                 break;
00542             case JCS_UNKNOWN:
00543                 memcpy(buffer, rect, 4 * ibuf->x);
00544                 break;
00545                 /* default was missing... intentional ? */
00546             default:
00547                 ; /* do nothing */
00548         }
00549 
00550         jpeg_write_scanlines(cinfo, row_pointer, 1);
00551     }
00552 
00553     jpeg_finish_compress(cinfo);
00554     MEM_freeN(row_pointer[0]);
00555 }
00556 
00557 
00558 static int init_jpeg(FILE * outfile, struct jpeg_compress_struct * cinfo, struct ImBuf *ibuf)
00559 {
00560     int quality;
00561 
00562     quality = ibuf->ftype & 0xff;
00563     if (quality <= 0) quality = jpeg_default_quality;
00564     if (quality > 100) quality = 100;
00565 
00566     jpeg_create_compress(cinfo);
00567     jpeg_stdio_dest(cinfo, outfile);
00568 
00569     cinfo->image_width = ibuf->x;
00570     cinfo->image_height = ibuf->y;
00571 
00572     cinfo->in_color_space = JCS_RGB;
00573     if (ibuf->planes == 8) cinfo->in_color_space = JCS_GRAYSCALE;
00574 #if 0
00575     /* just write RGBA as RGB,
00576      * unsupported feature only confuses other s/w */
00577 
00578     if (ibuf->planes == 32) cinfo->in_color_space = JCS_UNKNOWN;
00579 #endif
00580     switch(cinfo->in_color_space) {
00581         case JCS_RGB:
00582             cinfo->input_components = 3;
00583             break;
00584         case JCS_GRAYSCALE:
00585             cinfo->input_components = 1;
00586             break;
00587         case JCS_UNKNOWN:
00588             cinfo->input_components = 4;
00589             break;
00590             /* default was missing... intentional ? */
00591         default:
00592             ; /* do nothing */
00593     }
00594     jpeg_set_defaults(cinfo);
00595     
00596     /* own settings */
00597 
00598     cinfo->dct_method = JDCT_FLOAT;
00599     jpeg_set_quality(cinfo, quality, TRUE);
00600 
00601     return(0);
00602 }
00603 
00604 
00605 static int save_stdjpeg(const char *name, struct ImBuf *ibuf)
00606 {
00607     FILE * outfile;
00608     struct jpeg_compress_struct _cinfo, *cinfo = &_cinfo;
00609     struct my_error_mgr jerr;
00610 
00611     if ((outfile = BLI_fopen(name, "wb")) == NULL) return 0;
00612     jpeg_default_quality = 75;
00613 
00614     cinfo->err = jpeg_std_error(&jerr.pub);
00615     jerr.pub.error_exit = jpeg_error;
00616 
00617     /* Establish the setjmp return context for jpeg_error to use. */
00618     if (setjmp(jerr.setjmp_buffer)) {
00619         /* If we get here, the JPEG code has signaled an error.
00620          * We need to clean up the JPEG object, close the input file, and return.
00621          */
00622         jpeg_destroy_compress(cinfo);
00623         fclose(outfile);
00624         remove(name);
00625         return 0;
00626     }
00627 
00628     init_jpeg(outfile, cinfo, ibuf);
00629 
00630     write_jpeg(cinfo, ibuf);
00631 
00632     fclose(outfile);
00633     jpeg_destroy_compress(cinfo);
00634 
00635     return 1;
00636 }
00637 
00638 
00639 static int save_vidjpeg(const char *name, struct ImBuf *ibuf)
00640 {
00641     FILE * outfile;
00642     struct jpeg_compress_struct _cinfo, *cinfo = &_cinfo;
00643     struct my_error_mgr jerr;
00644 
00645     if ((outfile = BLI_fopen(name, "wb")) == NULL) return 0;
00646     jpeg_default_quality = 90;
00647 
00648     cinfo->err = jpeg_std_error(&jerr.pub);
00649     jerr.pub.error_exit = jpeg_error;
00650 
00651     /* Establish the setjmp return context for jpeg_error to use. */
00652     if (setjmp(jerr.setjmp_buffer)) {
00653         /* If we get here, the JPEG code has signaled an error.
00654          * We need to clean up the JPEG object, close the input file, and return.
00655          */
00656         jpeg_destroy_compress(cinfo);
00657         fclose(outfile);
00658         remove(name);
00659         return 0;
00660     }
00661 
00662     init_jpeg(outfile, cinfo, ibuf);
00663 
00664     /* adjust scaling factors */
00665     if (cinfo->in_color_space == JCS_RGB) {
00666         cinfo->comp_info[0].h_samp_factor = 2;
00667         cinfo->comp_info[0].v_samp_factor = 1;
00668     }
00669 
00670     write_jpeg(cinfo, ibuf);
00671 
00672     fclose(outfile);
00673     jpeg_destroy_compress(cinfo);
00674 
00675     return 1;
00676 }
00677 
00678 static int save_jstjpeg(const char *name, struct ImBuf *ibuf)
00679 {
00680     char fieldname[1024];
00681     struct ImBuf * tbuf;
00682     int oldy, returnval;
00683 
00684     tbuf = IMB_allocImBuf(ibuf->x, ibuf->y / 2, 24, IB_rect);
00685     tbuf->ftype = ibuf->ftype;
00686     tbuf->flags = ibuf->flags;
00687     
00688     oldy = ibuf->y;
00689     ibuf->x *= 2;
00690     ibuf->y /= 2;
00691 
00692     IMB_rectcpy(tbuf, ibuf, 0, 0, 0, 0, ibuf->x, ibuf->y);
00693     sprintf(fieldname, "%s.jf0", name);
00694 
00695     returnval = save_vidjpeg(fieldname, tbuf);
00696     if (returnval == 1) {
00697         IMB_rectcpy(tbuf, ibuf, 0, 0, tbuf->x, 0, ibuf->x, ibuf->y);
00698         sprintf(fieldname, "%s.jf1", name);
00699         returnval = save_vidjpeg(fieldname, tbuf);
00700     }
00701 
00702     ibuf->y = oldy;
00703     ibuf->x /= 2;
00704     IMB_freeImBuf(tbuf);
00705 
00706     return returnval;
00707 }
00708 
00709 static int save_maxjpeg(const char *name, struct ImBuf *ibuf)
00710 {
00711     FILE * outfile;
00712     struct jpeg_compress_struct _cinfo, *cinfo = &_cinfo;
00713     struct my_error_mgr jerr;
00714 
00715     if ((outfile = BLI_fopen(name, "wb")) == NULL) return 0;
00716     jpeg_default_quality = 100;
00717 
00718     cinfo->err = jpeg_std_error(&jerr.pub);
00719     jerr.pub.error_exit = jpeg_error;
00720 
00721     /* Establish the setjmp return context for jpeg_error to use. */
00722     if (setjmp(jerr.setjmp_buffer)) {
00723         /* If we get here, the JPEG code has signaled an error.
00724          * We need to clean up the JPEG object, close the input file, and return.
00725          */
00726         jpeg_destroy_compress(cinfo);
00727         fclose(outfile);
00728         remove(name);
00729         return 0;
00730     }
00731 
00732     init_jpeg(outfile, cinfo, ibuf);
00733 
00734     /* adjust scaling factors */
00735     if (cinfo->in_color_space == JCS_RGB) {
00736         cinfo->comp_info[0].h_samp_factor = 1;
00737         cinfo->comp_info[0].v_samp_factor = 1;
00738     }
00739 
00740     write_jpeg(cinfo, ibuf);
00741 
00742     fclose(outfile);
00743     jpeg_destroy_compress(cinfo);
00744 
00745     return 1;
00746 }
00747 
00748 int imb_savejpeg(struct ImBuf *ibuf, const char *name, int flags)
00749 {
00750     
00751     ibuf->flags = flags;
00752     if (IS_stdjpg(ibuf)) return save_stdjpeg(name, ibuf);
00753     if (IS_jstjpg(ibuf)) return save_jstjpeg(name, ibuf);
00754     if (IS_maxjpg(ibuf)) return save_maxjpeg(name, ibuf);
00755     return save_vidjpeg(name, ibuf);
00756 }
